com.mousebird.maply

Class GlobeMapFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.mousebird.maply.GlobeMapFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobeController.GestureDelegate, MapController.GestureDelegate

    public class GlobeMapFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements MapController.GestureDelegate, GlobeController.GestureDelegate
    A fragment that instantiates either a map or a globe. You subclass this and fill in the various stubs to implement your own map or globe.

    • Method Detail

      • chooseDisplayType

        protected GlobeMapFragment.MapDisplayType chooseDisplayType()
        Override this to tell the fragment you want either a map or a globe.

      • preControlCreated

        protected void preControlCreated()
        Override this to be called right before the map or globe is created. This is where you can mess with the globe or map settings.

      • controlHasStarted

        protected void controlHasStarted()
        Override this to be called when the control is up and running. There are many calls to the map or globe controller you shouldn't make until it has its OpenGL surface set up. This is where you make those calls. This will be on the main thread.

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle inState)
        This is the standard onCreateView() for the fragment. If you override it, be sure to call this one too. It does all the setup for the globe or map.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
        The standard fragment onSaveInstanceState(). The GlobeMapFragment is doing nothing at this point.

      • onViewStateRestored

        public void onViewStateRestored(android.os.Bundle inState)
        The standard fragment onRestoreInstanceState(). The GlobeMapFragment is doing nothing at this point.
        Parameters:
        inState -

      • onPause

        public void onPause()

      • onResume

        public void onResume()

      • onDestroyView

        public void onDestroyView()
        This is the standard fragment onDestroyView(). The GlobeMapFragment calls the controller shutdown here, so be sure to call it if you override this.

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()

      • userDidSelect

        public void userDidSelect(MapController mapControl,
                          SelectedObject[] selObjs,
                          Point2d loc,
                          Point2d screenLoc)
        The user selected the given object. Up to you to figure out what it is.
        Specified by:
        userDidSelect in interface MapController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        mapControl - The maply controller this is associated with.
        selObjs - The objects the user selected (e.g. MaplyScreenMarker).
        loc - The location they tapped on. This is in radians.
        screenLoc - The location on the OpenGL surface.

      • userDidLongPress

        public void userDidLongPress(MapController mapController,
                             SelectedObject[] selObjs,
                             Point2d loc,
                             Point2d screenLoc)
        The user long pressed somewhere, either on a selectable object or nor
        Specified by:
        userDidLongPress in interface MapController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        mapController - The maply controller this is associated with.
        selObjs - The objects (e.g. MaplyScreenMarker) that the user long pressed or null if there was none
        loc - The location they tapped on. This is in radians.
        screenLoc - The location on the OpenGL surface.

      • mapDidStartMoving

        public void mapDidStartMoving(MapController mapControl,
                              boolean userMotion)
        Called when the map first starts moving.
        Specified by:
        mapDidStartMoving in interface MapController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        mapControl - The map controller this is associated with.
        userMotion - Set if the motion was caused by a gesture.

      • mapDidStopMoving

        public void mapDidStopMoving(MapController mapControl,
                             Point3d[] corners,
                             boolean userMotion)
        Called when the map stops moving.
        Specified by:
        mapDidStopMoving in interface MapController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        mapControl - The map controller this is associated with.
        corners - Corners of the viewport. If one of them is null, that means it doesn't land anywhere valid.
        userMotion - Set if the motion was caused by a gesture.

      • mapDidMove

        public void mapDidMove(MapController mapControl,
                       Point3d[] corners,
                       boolean userMotion)
        Called for every single visible frame of movement. Be careful what you do in here.
        Specified by:
        mapDidMove in interface MapController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        mapControl - The map controller this is associated with.
        corners - Corners of the viewport. If one of them is null, that means it doesn't land anywhere valid.
        userMotion - Set if the motion was caused by a gesture.

        Specified by:
        userDidTap in interface GlobeController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        globeControl - The maply controller this is associated with.
        loc - The location they tapped on. This is in radians. If null, then the user tapped outside the globe.
        screenLoc - The location on the OpenGL surface.

      • globeDidStopMoving

        public void globeDidStopMoving(GlobeController globeControl,
                               Point3d[] corners,
                               boolean userMotion)
        Called when the globe stops moving.
        Specified by:
        globeDidStopMoving in interface GlobeController.GestureDelegate
        Parameters:
        globeControl - The globe controller this is associated with.
        corners - Corners of the viewport. If one of them is null, that means it doesn't land on the globe.
        userMotion - Set if the motion was caused by a gesture.
